Their decision is influenced by a physician's recommendation and colorful tales from an African woman about the beauty and wealth of the land. As they set sail aboard the Trojan, chaos ensues when Louise realizes she has left her diary behind, prompting a frantic cab ride back to retrieve it just before the ship departs. The text sets the stage for an exploration of different cultures, landscapes, and the experiences that will unfold as the sisters journey deeper into the region filled with Zulus and missionaries.
